Detailed Description

This class represents an abstract model on a scenario element.

It acts as a base class for visualization, collision and deformation models. vtkModel class has 2 inputs. By default the input data will be read from a vtp file specified in FileName attribute. A second optional parameter is available, the source mesh. Main input will be adapted to the source mesh (point positions will be synchronized) The output displays the transformed mesh according to transformation matrix values.

void vtkModel::Init ( ) [virtual]

Virtual initialization function.

The model has to be initialized in order to be updated. At least one parameter must be previously defined:

  • Input: vtkPolyData object

Reimplemented in vtkCollisionModel, vtkCUDAParticleSystemInterface, vtkDeformationModel, vtkEDMInterface, vtkParticleSpringSystemInterface, and vtkVisualizationModel.

bool vtkModel::IsDisabled ( ) [inline]

Check if model is disabled.

When an model is disabled it will NOT:

  • be visible.
  • be computed in collision detection.
  • be used in simulation.
bool vtkModel::IsHidden ( ) [inline]

Check if model is hidden.

When an model is disabled it will NOT:

  • be visible.
  • be computed in collision detection. It will be used in simulation.
bool vtkModel::IsVisible ( ) [inline]

Check if model is visible.

When an model is disabled it will:

  • be visible.
  • be computed in collision detection.
  • be used in simulation.

void vtkModel::SetSource ( vtkPolyData *  source) [virtual]

Specify the source object for mesh synchronization purposes.

This is an optional input. If source is set, the model primary mesh will be synchronized to this source mesh whenever a change is made on it.

See also:
vtkPolyData* GetSource()
